title: Language Education Storytelling Design Using Large-Scale Film Production Techniques: Enhancing Expressiveness, Reading Comprehension, and Writing Skills Through Integration of Visual Representation and Narrative Structure

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (reading, writing, speaking, listening), experience in educational content creation, comprehension of visual expression and basic grammar/vocabulary knowledge, and basic understanding of cultural contexts
context.additional_context: Focuses on enhancing learners' language expression (speaking, writing), reading comprehension (text/image analysis), and writing skills through smartphone-based participation, real-time interaction, and collaborative learning. Includes multilingual expression examples and non-verbal expressions (gestures, visual symbols) to strengthen intercultural communication competencies. Emphasizes improving expressive skills through peer feedback activities.

learning_goals: Learners will enhance expressive skills (speaking/writing) and integrated text/image comprehension by designing language learning scenarios and dialogues using the three-act narrative structure of filmmaking.
Learners will develop narrative-based dialogue content (integrating grammar/vocabulary with cultural context) to motivate language learning by applying character arc techniques.

Using smartphone filming/editing tools (CapCut, Canva), learners will produce ≥3 visual storytelling contents and develop 1 integrated language education module combining text-image techniques. The module must achieve 'B+' or higher in ≥4 of 5 institutional rubric criteria (content organization, tech utilization, educational effectiveness, cultural relevance, learner engagement).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
